page.title: 07INDUSTRY..QUARRYING
page.content: There are 14 active quarries in N.E. Fife and of these, 8 quarries for sand and gravel. Quarries cover 4.5% of this D_Block. Kinloch Quarry (owned by Pioneer Aggrigates, an Australian firm) covers an area of 22.1 hectares. It started in 1981 and has an operational life of 8_10 years. 2 million tonnes of sand and gravel are to be quarried. This quarry produces on average, 1000 tonnes a day. The operation is highly mechanised and only 7 people are employed on the site. 90% of the sand and gravel is used in making concrete and is sent to firms in Leven, Perth and Dundee.The rest is sold to local building firms and to Scottish Gas who use it for bedding their gas pipelines.
